question: Which of the following was the main purpose of passing the Sarda Act?
option2: To legalize the trial of Europeans by Indian judges
option4: To punish the Indian freedom fighters
explanation: Sarda Act was passed in the year 1929 (28th September). Its main objective was to restrain the Child Marriage. It is also known as the Child Marriage Act of 1929. After passing the act, the minimum age for marriage of the girls and boys became 14 and 18 respectively.
